explanation: Performs TCP port-knocking with nc -z (no data) to trigger an access control change, then probes SSH to confirm it opened. Detection: inspect firewall logs for SYNs to unusual sequences preceding an allowed SSH connection.
rationale_steps: Leverages nc -z to send TCP SYN-only probes as the signaling mechanism.
Maintains ordering and short timing between knocks to match server expectations.
Follows up with a verification SYN to TCP/22.
Detect by alerting on clustered SYNs to unusual high ports followed by SSH acceptance.
